name: Roaring, Squealing, and Clucking Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: I'm a kitten. When I'm mad I _______.
questions.explanation:
hiss.

	Cats meow, hiss, purr, and yowl. Sometimes they make funny little muttering sounds when they see their prey.

questions.text: I'm a lion cub. My dad _______ to show other lions who's boss.
questions.explanation:
roars.

	Male lions' manes help make them look bigger and scarier to other males.

questions.text: I'm a piglet. When I'm hungry I _______.
questions.explanation:
squeal.

	Did you see the movie "Babe"? It has some cute piglets in it. If you like pigs, get your parents to read you one of the "Freddy the Pig" books by Walter R. Brooks.

questions.text: I'm a calf. Who is my mother, and what sound does she make?
questions.explanation:
She's a cow that moos.

	A heifer is a young cow that hasn't had babies yet. A bullock is a young bull.

questions.text: I'm a puppy. When I'm lonely I might _______.
questions.explanation:
howl.

	Dogs are pack animals, so they get lonely if they aren't around people or other dogs.

questions.text: I'm an elephant calf. My dad sometimes makes a _______ sound.
questions.explanation:
trumpeting.

	Elephants use their trunks to make trumpeting sounds. They may trumpet to show joy or anger.

questions.text: I'm a chick. My mother _______ and I _______.
questions.explanation:
clucks/peep.

	In the "Freddy the Pig" books there is a rooster named Charles who loves to make long, boring speeches to the other barnyard animals. He has a grouchy wife named Henrietta who is always shushing him. Charles is literally a henpecked husband.

questions.text: I'm a foal. What's my father called and what sound does he make?
questions.explanation:
He's a stallion that neighs.

	Foals, colts, and fillies are baby horses. Mares are adult females, and stallions are adult males. Horses whinny, neigh, and nicker. They also snort.

questions.text: I'm a tadpole. What sound do my parents make?
questions.explanation:
They croak.

	Tadpoles are baby frogs. They live underwater like fishes until they grow their legs and become able to breathe air. Then they can live on land.

questions.text: I'm a joey. How do my parents signal that danger is near?
questions.correct: They thump their big feet on the ground.
options: They raise their trunks and trumpet.
They flap their wings and screech.
questions.explanation:
They thump their big feet on the ground.

	Kangaroos don't make much noise. Male kangaroos may grunt to each other, and females may cluck or click to call their joeys.
